meanings.definition: To move or shift from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I will emmove the chair to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: She likes to emmove her toys around the playroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat decided to emmove all the pillows from the couch.
meanings.sent4: The wind can emmove the sand dunes in the desert over time.
meanings.sent5: Please remember to emmove your car from the parking lot before it gets towed.

meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks always emmove the audience.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news emmoved everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The lively music seemed to emmove the sleepy dog to dance.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech emmoved the crowd to take action.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling movie plot will emmove you to the edge of your seat.

meanings.definition: To cause to change position or direction.
meanings.sent1: The strong gust of wind emmoved the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The captain had to emmove the ship away from the rocky shore.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected turn of events emmoved the story in a new direction.
meanings.sent4: His inspiring words emmoved her to reconsider her plans.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in weather can emmove our outdoor plans.
